title: Man charged in fatal shooting of Rock Hill teen
content:
ROCK HILL, S.C. – Police in Rock Hill have charged a 20-year-old man in connection with the fatal shooting of a teenager Saturday night.
Just before 10 o’clock, officers were dispatched to a shooting in the 800 block of Horseman Drive in Rock Hill. When officers arrived on the scene, they found a 17-year-old male suffering from an apparent gunshot wound. The victim, later identified as Jaterreon Thorne was pronounced dead on the scene.
Investigators determined that the shooting was not a homicide and was accidental. According to Rock Hill Police, 20-year-old Robreece Pickett was handling a handgun when it went off, shooting the victim.
Pickett has been charged with involuntary manslaughter and unlawful carry of a weapon. He is currently being held under a $115,000 bond.
